name: cryolite production, from fluosilicic acid | silica sand | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3896/documentation

The dataset represents the production of cryolite from fluosilicic acid. The reaction yield is assumed to be 95% since no specific data is available.  Water produced in the reaction is not considered as a byproduct, but assumed to be recovered and recycled internally.;The reaction process is shown below:;Al2O3 + 2H2SiF6 + 6 NaOH --> 2 Na3AlF6 + 2 SiO2 + 5 H2O 

From reception of fluosilicic acid, sodium hydroxide and aluminium oxide at the factory gate.

The dataset includes the production of cryolite by chemical reaction of reactants at the chemical plant. Included are the estimated emissions to air and water from production. The energy demand and infrastructure of the plant are approximated. Solid wastes are omitted.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: publication year of patent (refer to published source)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data used has no specific geographical origin (stoechiometry).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The main production of cryolite involves hydrofluoric acid or fluosilicic acid. In both cases, the reactants can be combined with a variety of materials, such as Al2O3 · 3 H2O, Al2O3 · x NaOH,  NaOH, NaCl, and Na2SO4. During the present reaction, fluosilicic acid is neutralised with sodium hydroxide.  Then it reacts with Al2O3 to produce cryolite and silica.;The reaction process is shown below:;Al2O3 + 2H2SiF6 + 6 NaOH --> 2 Na3AlF6 + 2 SiO2 + 5 H2O ;It is difficult to predict how much of the cryolite is produced with the present reaction, since many production routes exist. The present inventory serves as an illustration of the cryolite production from fluosilicic acid. The alternative production route with HF is still considered to be the main production route (source: Ullmann encyclopedia, Cryolite, 2005).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Energy consumptions and emissions as well as Infrastructure are estimated.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Inventory based on patent and literature review. No public data for cryolite from the European Aluminium Association was identified. The chemical reaction is based on stoichiometric principles. Infrastructure, energy and water demand based on approximation from large chemical plant. Process emissions based on general estimations.

exchanges.description:
silica sand is used as an approximation of silicon dioxide, since the product silicon dioxide is not present in the current database. This value will be substituted when better data is available.
Calculation based on stoichiometric relationship. In this case, silica sand is considered to be pure silicone dioxide (SiO2).

flow.name: silica sand
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay

exchanges.description:
Estimation. From the input of sodium hydroxide, one part will leave the process as emission to the water. The formula is the following:

mass sodium to water=(((1/0.95)-1)*mass sodium input)-mb air))*0.1

Note: reaction yield is 95%; mb air = mass to air, in this case it is assumed that no sodium hydroxide leaves the process to air.

Note: the mass of sodium is calculated with the respective molar weight and stoichiometric relation betweent NaOH and Na - 1 mol of Na are needed in 1 mol of NaOH. Molecular weight of Na = 23 g/mol
Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

exchanges.description:
Estimation. From the input of fluosilicic acid, one part will leave the process as emission to the water. The formula is the following:

mass fluosilicic acid to water=(((1/0.95)-1)*mass fluosilicic acid input)-mb air))*0.1

Note: reaction yield is 95%; mb air = mass to air, in this case it is assumed that no fluosilicic acid leaves the process to air, since it is a liquid.

Estimation. These values were approximated with data from an large chemical plant site in Germany producing 2.05 Mt a-1 (intermediates included) of different chemicals. The values for the energy consumption per kg of product of this plant (3.2 MJ kg-1) were used as approximation for the energy consumption. This total energy demand contains a split of 50% natural gas, 38% electricity and 12% steam from external energy sources. For this inventory all energy used for heat or steam was assumed to be natural gas.
EcoSpold01Location=RER
